isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9800 SERIES - REPLACE - CLUTCH CONTROL ROD

step1.para: Remove the radiator grille upper panel, the headlamp bezels, and the radiator grille lower panel.
Tilt the cab forward (45 degrees) and secure with the safety prop.

warning.para: Be sure to install the safety prop when the cab is tilted 45 degrees. Failure to do so could cause serious injury or death.

step1.para: Working through the radiator grille opening, remove the control rod return spring ( Figure 1).
Disconnect upper (vertical) control rod from the pedal shaft lever and relay lever by removing the cotter pin yoke pins.
Inspect the yoke pin holes in the pedal shaft lever and the relay lever. If worn, replace the levers. Inspect the yoke pins. Replace if worn.
Assemble the new adjusting yoke and lock nut to the new control rod. Do not tighten the nut.
Connect the new control rod to pedal shaft lever with the yoke pin and install the cotter pin.
With the pedal fully returned against the pedal stop, adjust the control rod adjusting yoke to align with the centerline of the cab pivot bolt ( Figure 3).
Connect the control rod to the relay lever with the yoke pin and install the cotter pin. Tighten the adjusting yoke lock nut.

important.para: All yoke pins must be installed so that the end with the cotter pin hole points outward (toward the driver's side of vehicle).

step1.para: Install the return spring.
Lower the cab.

Check the clutch internal, clutch pedal and release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance adjustments and readjust if needed. Refer to ADJUSTMENT
.
Install the radiator grille panels and headlamp bezels.
Tilt the cab fully forward.

caution.para: Before fully tilting the cab, be sure that the area in front of the cab is clear of anything that would cause damage to the cab when it is fully tilted.

step1.para: Disconnect the lower (horizontal) control rod from the relay lever and release the shaft lever by removing the cotter and yoke pins. Remove the control rod from vehicle.
Inspect the yoke pin holes in the relay and release shaft levers. If worn, replace the levers.
Assemble a new adjusting yoke and lock nut to a new control rod. Coat the threads of the control rod, lock nut and adjusting yoke with an anti-rust compound ("Never-Seez" or equivalent).
Position the control rod assembly in the vehicle. Connect the rod assembly to the relay lever and install the cotter pin.
Lower the cab.

Check the clutch internal and clutch pedal adjustments and re-adjust if needed. Refer to ADJUSTMENT
.

Adjust the lower control rod (release shaft yoke to release bearing clearance) and connect the control rod to the release shaft lever. Refer to RELEASE SHAFT YOKE TO RELEASE BEARING CLEARANCE
. Install the cotter pin.
